message: Starting error handling audit - identifying main MCP server files and SQLite operations
Identified key files - now searching for exception handling patterns in real_mcp_server.py and orchestrator modules
Found 30+ bare except: blocks that catch all exceptions. Now analyzing SQLite rollback patterns and functions returning errors instead of raising
SQLite transactions have proper rollback. Now checking for functions returning {"success": False} instead of raising exceptions
Found additional functions returning None on all exceptions. Now checking for missing error context in logging and examining workspace.py patterns

Error handling audit complete. Found: (1) 30+ bare 'except:' blocks catching ALL exceptions including KeyboardInterrupt (HIGH severity) across orchestrator/status.py, lifecycle.py, state_db.py, registry.py, real_mcp_server.py. (2) Functions returning None on all exceptions masking errors (MEDIUM) in state_db.py:405-417, 420-439, health_daemon.py:271-291, 252-253. (3) Inconsistent error handling architecture mixing raising/dict-return/None-return patterns (HIGH recommendation). POSITIVE: SQLite transactions have proper BEGIN IMMEDIATE + ROLLBACK handling - no leaked transactions found. Detailed findings with file:line citations reported via report_agent_finding.
